intro: Mitraria pallida, commonly known as the white mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of various host trees. It belongs to the family Viscaceae and is characterized by its small, white, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are often eaten by birds, which then disperse its seeds. Mitraria pallida is native to parts of Africa and is often found in forested areas with a humid climate. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
